provenance: Hans Fetscherin, Munich, Germany; sold to MIA, 1969.
signed: Signed and dated in pencil, LR margin: Erich Heckel 14
text: One of the leading German Expressionist artists, Erich Heckel championed the reinvigoration of German art by a return to the woodcut, a medium associated with both medieval German art and the primal energies of tribal art. Here Heckel portrays his future wife, Sidi Riha, with downcast eyes, full of melancholic, brooding emotion. Sidi was a dancer and seems to have been well aware of the power of gesture.
title: Crouching Nude
